title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: three principles of Man, according to the doctrine of the Platonists; as
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: first of the Intellect, Spirit, or Divine Light. 2. Of the Soul of Man
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: her self: and 3. Of the Image of the Soul, that is, her vital operation
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: on the body? The Spirits answered, That they did not understand these
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: three distinctions, but that they seem'd to corporeal sense and reason,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: as if they were three several bodies, or three several corporeal
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: actions; however, said they, they are intricate conceptions of irregular
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Fancies. If you do not understand them, replied the Empress, how shall
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: human Creatures do then? Many, both of your modern and ancient
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Philosophers, answered the Spirits, endeavour to go beyond Sense and
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Reason, which makes them commit absurdities; for no corporeal Creature
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: can go beyond Sense and Reason; no not we Spirits, as long as we are in
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: our corporeal Vehicles. Then the Empress asked them, Whether there were
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: any Atheists in the World? The Spirits answered, That there were no more
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Atheists then what Cabbalists make. she asked them further, Whether
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Spirits were of a globous or round Figure? They answered, That Figure
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: belonged to body, but they being immaterial, had no Figure. she asked
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: again, Whether Spirits were not like Water or Fire? They answered, that
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Water and Fire was material, were it the purest and most refined that
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: ever could be; nay, were it above the Heavens: But we are no more like
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Water or Fire, said they, then we are like Earth; but our Vehicles are
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: of several forms, figures and degrees of substances. Then she desired to
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: know, Whether their Vehicles were made of Air? Yes, answered the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Spirits, some of our Vehicles are of thin Air. Then I suppose, replied
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: the Empress, That those airy Vehicles, are your corporeal Summer-suits.
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: she asked further, Whether the Spirits had not ascending and
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: descending-motions, as well as other Creatures? They answered, That
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: properly there was no ascension or descension in Infinite Nature, but
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: onely in relation to particular parts; and as for us Spirits, said they,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: We can neither ascend nor descend without corporeal Vehicles; nor can
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: our Vehicles ascend or descend, but according to their several shapes
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: and figures, for there can be no motion without body. The Empress asked
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: them further, Whether there was not a World of Spirits, as well as there
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: is of Material Creatures? No, answered they; for the word World implies
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: a quantity or multitude of corporeal Creatures, but we being Immaterial,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: can make no World of Spirits. Then she desired to be informed when
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Spirits were made? We do not know, answered they, how and when we were
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: made, nor are we much inquisitive after it; nay, if we did, it would be
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: no benefit, neither for us, nor for you Mortals to know it. The Empress
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: replied, That Cabbalists and Divine Philosophers said, Mens rational
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Souls were Immaterial, and stood as much in need of corporeal Vehicles,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: as Spirits did. If this be so, answered the Spirits, then you are
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Hermaphrodites of Nature; but your Cabbalists are mistaken, for they
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: take the purest and subtilest parts of Matter, for Immaterial Spirits.
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Then the Empress asked, When the Souls of Mortals went out of their
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Bodies, whether they went to Heaven or Hell; or whether, they remained
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: in airy Vehicles? God's Justice and Mercy, answered they, is perfect,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: and not imperfect; but if you Mortals will have Vehicles for your Souls,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: and a place that is between Heaven and Hell, it must be Purgatory, which
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: is a place of Purification, for which action Fire is more proper then
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Air; and so the Vehicles of those Souls that are in Purgatory, cannot be
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: airy, but fiery; and after this rate there can be but four places for
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: human Souls to be in, viz. Heaven, Hell, Purgatory, and this World; but
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: as for Vehicles, they are but fancies, not real truths. Then the Empress
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: asked them, Where Heaven and Hell was? Your Saviour Christ, answered the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Spirits, has informed you, that there is Heaven and Hell, but he did not
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: tell you what, nor where they are; wherefore it is too great a
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: presumption for you Mortals to inquire after it: If you do but strive to
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: get into Heaven, it is enough, though you do not know where or what it
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: is; for it is beyond your knowledg and understanding. I am satisfied,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: replied the Empress; and asked further, Whether there were any Figures
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: or Characters in the Soul? They answered, Where there was no Body, there
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: could be no Figure. Then she asked them, Whether Spirits could be naked?
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: and whether they were of a dark, or a light colour? As for our
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Nakedness, it is a very odd question, answered the Spirits; and we do
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: not know what you mean by a Naked Spirit; for you judg of us as of
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: corporeal Creatures; and as for Colour, said they, it is according to
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: our Vehicles; for Colour belongs to Body, and as there is no Body that
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: is colourless, so there is no Colour that is bodiless. Then the Empress
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: desired to be informed, Whether all Souls were made at the first
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Creation of the World? We know no more, answered the Spirits, of the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: origin of humane Souls, then we know of our Selves. she asked further,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Whether humane bodies were not burthensome to humane Souls? They
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: answered, That Bodies, made Souls active, as giving them motion; and if
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: action was troublesome to Souls, then Bodies were so too. she asked
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: again, Whether Souls did chuse Bodies? They answered, That Platonicks
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: believed, the Souls of Lovers lived in the Bodies of their Beloved, but
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: surely, said they, if there be a multitude of Souls in a World of
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Matter, they cannot miss Bodies; for as soon as a Soul is parted from
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: one Body, it enters into another; and Souls having no motion of
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: themselves, must of necessity be clothed or imbodied with the next parts
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: of Matter. If this be so, replied the Empress, then I pray inform me,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Whether all matter be soulified? The Spirits answered, They could not
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: exactly tell that; but if it was true, that Matter had no other motion
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: but what came from a spiritual power, and that all matter was moving,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: then no soul could quit a Body, but she must, of necessity enter into
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: another soulified Body, and then there would be two immaterial
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: substances in one Body. The Empress asked, Whether it was not possible
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: that there could be two Souls in one Body? As for Immaterial Souls,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: answered the Spirits, it is impossible; for there cannot be two
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Immaterials in one Inanimate Body, by reason they want parts, and place,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: being bodiless; but there may be numerous material Souls in one composed
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Body, by reason every material part has a material natural Soul; for
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Nature is but one Infinite self-moving, living and self-knowing body,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: consisting of the three degrees of inanimate, sensitive and rational
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Matter, so intermixt together, that no part of Nature, were it an Atom,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: can be without any of these three Degrees; the sensitive is the Life,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: the rational the Soul, and the inanimate part, the Body of Infinite
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Nature. The Empress was very well satisfied with this answer, and asked
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: further, Whether souls did not give life to bodies? No, answered they;
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: but Spirits and Divine Souls have a life of their own, which is not to
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: be divided, being purer then a natural life; for Spirits are
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: incorporeal, and consequently indivisible. But when the Soul is in its
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Vehicle, said the Empress, then methinks she is like the Sun, and the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Vehicle like the Moon. No, answered they; but the Vehicle is like the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Sun, and the Soul like the Moon; for the Soul hath motion from the Body,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: as the Moon has light from the Sun. Then the Empress asked the Spirits,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Whether it was an evil Spirit that tempted Eve, and brought all the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: mischiefs upon Mankind: or, Whether it was the Serpent? They answered,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: That Spirits could not commit actual evils. The Empress said, they might
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: do it by perswasions. They answered, That Perswasions were actions; But
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: the Empress not being contented with this answer, asked, Whether there
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: was not a supernatural Evil? The Spirits answered, That there was a
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Supernatural Good, which was God; but they knew of no Supernatural Evil,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: that was equal to God. Then she desired to know, Whether Evil Spirits
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: were reckoned amongst the Beasts of the Field? They answer'd, That many
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Beasts of the field were harmless Creatures, and very serviceable for
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Man's use; and though some were accounted fierce and cruel, yet did they
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: exercise their cruelty upon other Creatures, for the most part, to no
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: other end, but to get themselves food, and to satisfie their natural
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: appetite; but certainly, said they, you Men are more cruel to one
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: another, then evil Spirits are to you; and as for their habitations in
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: desolate places, we having no communion with them, can give you no
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: certain account thereof. But what do you think, said the Empress, of
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: good Spirits? may not they be compared to the Fowls of the Air? They
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: answered, There were many cruel and ravenous Fowls as well in the Air,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: as there were fierce and cruel Beasts on Earth; so that the good are
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: always mixt with the bad. she asked further, Whether the fiery Vehicles
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: were a Heaven, or a Hell, or at least a Purgatory to the Souls? They
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: answered, That if the Souls were immaterial, they could not burn, and
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: then fire would do them no harm; and though Hell was believed to be an
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: undecaying and unquenchable fire, yet Heaven was no fire. The Empress
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: replied, That Heaven was a Light. Yes, said they, but not a fiery Light.
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Then she asked, Whether the different shapes and sorts of Vehicles, made
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: the Souls and other Immaterial Spirits, miserable, or blessed? The
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Vehicles, answered they, make them neither better, nor worse; for though
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: some Vehicles sometimes may have power over others, yet these by turns
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: may get some power again over them, according to the several advantages
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: and disadvantages of particular Natural parts. The Empress asked
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: further, Whether Animal life came out of the spiritual World, and did
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: return thither again? The Spirits answered, They could not exactly tell;
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: but if it were so, then certainly Animal lives must leave their bodies
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: behind them, otherwise the bodies would make the spiritual World a mixt
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: World, that is, partly material, and partly immaterial; but the Truth
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: is, said they, Spirits being immaterial, cannot properly make a World;
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: for a World belongs to material, not to immaterial Creatures. If this be
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: so, replied the Empress, then certainly there can be no world of Lives
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: and Forms without Matter? No, answered the Spirits; nor a world of
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Matter without Lives and Forms; for Natural Lives and Forms cannot be
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: immaterial, no more then Matter can be immovable. And therefore natural
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: lives, forms and matter, are inseparable. Then the Empress asked,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Whether the first Man did feed on the best sorts of the Fruits of the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Earth, and the Beasts on the worst? The Spirits answered, That unless
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: the Beasts of the field were barred out of manured fields and gardens,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: they would pick and chuse the best Fruits as well as Men; and you may
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: plainly observe it, said they, in Squirrels and Monkies, how they are
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: the best Chusers of Nuts and Apples; and how Birds do pick and feed in
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: the most delicious fruits, and Worms on the best roots, and most savoury
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: herbs; by which you may see, that those Creatures live and feed better
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: then men do, except you will say, that artificial Cookery is better and
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: more wholsome then the natural. Again, the Empress asked, Whether the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: first Man gave Names to all the several sorts of Fishes in the Sea, and
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: fresh Waters? No, answered the Spirits, for he was an Earthly, and not a
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Watery Creature; and therefore could not know the several sorts of
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Fishes. Why, replied the Empress, he was no more an Airy Creature then
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: he was a Watery one, and yet he gave Names to the several sorts of Fowls
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: and Birds of the Air. Fowls, answered they, are partly Airy, and partly
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Earthly Creatures, not onely because they resemble Beasts and Men in
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: their flesh, but because their rest and dwelling places are on Earth;
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: for they build their Nests, lay their Eggs, and hatch their Young, not
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: in the Air, but on the Earth. Then she asked, Whether the first Man did
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: give Names to all the various sorts of Creatures that live on the Earth?
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Yes, answered they, to all those that were presented to him, or he had
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

title: Cavendish, Margaret

author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: that are without such Artificial Rules. The Emperor asked, Are those
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: good Plays that are made so Methodically and Artificially? The Duchess
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: answer'd, They were Good according to the Judgment of the Age, or Mode
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: of the Nation, but not according to her Judgment: for truly, said she,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: in my Opinion, their Plays will prove a Nursery of whining Lovers, and
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: not an Academy or School for Wise, Witty, Noble and well-behaved men.
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: But I, replied the Emperor, desire such a Theatre as may make wise Men;
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: and will have such Descriptions as are Natural, not Artificial. If your
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Majesty be of that Opinion, said the Duchess's Soul, then my Playes may
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: be acted in your Blazing- World, when they cannot be acted in the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Blinking-World of Wit; and the next time I come to visit your Majesty, I
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: shall endeavour to order your Majesty's Theatre, to present such Playes
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: as my Wit is capable to make. Then the Empress told the Duchess, That
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: she loved a foolish Farse added to a wise Play. The Duchess answered,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: That no World in Nature had fitter Creatures for it than the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Blazing-World: for, said she, the Lowse- men, the Bird-men, the Spider-
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: and Fox-men, the Ape-men and Satyrs appear in a Farse extraordinary
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: pleasant.
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Hereupon both the Emperor and Empress intreated the Duchess's Soul to
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: stay so long with them, till she had ordered her Theatre, and made
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Playes and Farses fit for them; for they onely wanted that sort of
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Recreation: but the Duchess's Soul begg'd their Majesties to give her
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: leave to go into her Native World; for she long'd to be with her dear
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Lord and Husband, promising, that after a short time she would return
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: again. Which being granted, though with much difficulty, she took her
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: leave with all Civility and Respect, and so departed from their Majesties.
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: After the Duchess's return into her own body, she entertained her Lord
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: (when he was pleased to hear such kind of Discourses) with Foreign
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Relations; but he was never displeased to hear of the Empress's kind
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Commendations, and of the Characters she was pleased to give of him to
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: the Emperor. Amongst other Relations, she told him all what had past
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: between the Empress, and the several Monarchs of that World whither she
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: went with the Empress; and how she had subdued them to pay Tribute and
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Homage to the Monarch of that Nation or Kingdom to which she owed both
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: her Birth and Education. she also related to her Lord what Magnificent
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Stables and Riding-Houses the Emperor had built, and what fine Horses
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: were in the Blazing-World, of several shapes and sizes, and how exact
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: their shapes were in each sort, and of many various Colours, and fine
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Marks, as if they had been painted by Art, with such Coats or Skins,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: that they had a far greater gloss and smoothness than Satin; and were
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: there but a passage out of the Blazing-World into this, said she, you
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: should not onely have some of those Horses, but such Materials as the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Emperor has, to build your Stables and Riding-Houses withall; and so
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: much Gold, that I should never repine at your Noble and Generous Gifts.
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: The Duke smilingly answered her, That he was sorry there was no Passage
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: between those two Worlds; but, said he, I have always found an
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Obstruction to my Good Fortunes.
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: One time the Duchess chanced to discourse with some of her acquaintance,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: of the Empress of the Blazing-World, who asked her what Pastimes and
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Recreations her Majesty did most delight in? The Duchess answered, That
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: she spent most of her time in the study of Natural Causes and Effects,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: which was her chief delight and pastime; and that she loved to discourse
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: sometimes with the most Learned persons of that World: And to please the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Emperor and his Nobles, who were all of the Royal Race, she went often
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: abroad to take the air, but seldom in the day-time, always at night, if
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: it might be called Night; for, said she, the Nights there, are as light
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: as Days, by reason of the numerous Blazing-Stars, which are very
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: splendorous, onely their Light is whiter than the Sun's Light; and as
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: the Sun's Light is hot, so their Light is cool; not so cool as our
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: twinkling Starr-light, nor is their Sun-light so hot as ours, but more
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: rate: And that part of the Blazing-World where the Empress resides, is
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: always clear, and never subject to any Storms, Tempests, Fogs or Mists,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: but has onely refreshing-Dews that nourish the Earth: The air of it is
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: sweet and temperate, and, as I said before, as much light in the Sun's
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: absence, as in its presence, which makes that time we call Night, more
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: pleasant there than the Day: And sometimes the Empress goes abroad by
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Water in Barges, sometimes by Land in Chariots, and sometimes on
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Horse-back; her Royal Chariots are very Glorious, the Body is one intire
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: green Diamond; the four small Pillars that bear up the Top-cover, are
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: four white Diamonds, cut in the form thereof; the top or roof of the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Chariot, is one intire blew Diamond, and at the four corners are great
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: springs of Rubies; the Seat is made of Cloth of Gold, stuffed with
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Ambergreece beaten small: the Chariot is drawn by Twelve Unicorns, whose
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Trappings are all Chains of Pearl; and as for her Barges, they are onely
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: of Gold. Her Guard of State (for she needs none for security, there
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: being no Rebels or Enemies) consists of Giants, but they seldom wait on
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: their Majesties abroad, because their extraordinary height and bigness
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: does hinder their prospect. Her Entertainment when she is upon the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Water, is the Musick of the Fish- and Bird-men; and by Land are Horse
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: and Foot-matches; for the Empress takes much delight in making
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Race-matches with the Emperor, and the Nobility; some Races are between
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: the Fox- and Ape-men, which sometimes the Satyrs strive to outrun; and
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: some are between the Spider-men and Lice-men. Also there are several
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Flight-matches, between the several sorts of Bird-men, and the several
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: sorts of Fly-men; and swimming-matches, between the several sorts of
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Fish-men. The Emperor, Empress, and their Nobles, take also great
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: delight to have Collations; for in the Blazing-World, there are most
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: delicious Fruits of all sorts, and some such as in this World were never
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: seen nor tasted; for there are most tempting sorts of Fruit: After their
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Collations are ended, they Dance; and if they be upon the Water, they
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: dance upon the Water, there lying so many Fish-men so close and thick
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: together, as they can dance very evenly and easily upon their backs, and
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: need not fear drowning. Their Musick, both Vocal and Instrumental, is
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: according to their several places: Upon the Water, it is of
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Water-Instruments, as shells filled with Water, and so moved by Art,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: which is a very sweet and delightful harmony; and those Dances which
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: they dance upon the Water, are, for the most part, such as we in this
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: World call swimming- Dances, where they do not lift up their feet high:
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: In Lawns, or upon Plains, they have Wind-Instruments, but much better
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: than those in our World: And when they dance in the Woods, they have
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Horn-Instruments, which although they are of a sort of Wind-Instruments,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: yet they are of another Fashion than the former: In their Houses they
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: have such Instruments as are somewhat like our Viols, Violins,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Theorboes, Lutes, Citherins, Gittars, Harpsichords, and the like; but
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: yet so far beyond them, that the difference cannot well be exprest; and
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: as their places of Dancing, and their Musick is different, so is their
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: manner or way of Dancing. In these and the like Recreations, the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Emperor, Empress, and the Nobility pass their time.

text: By this Poetical Description, you may perceive, that my ambition is not
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: onely to be Empress, but Authoress of a whole World; and that the Worlds
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: I have made, both the Blazing- and the other Philosophical World,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: mentioned in the first part of this Description, are framed and composed
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: of the most pure, that is, the Rational parts of Matter, which are the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: parts of my Mind; which Creation was more easily and suddenly effected,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: than the Conquests of the two famous Monarchs of the World. Alexander
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: and Cesar. Neither have I made such disturbances, and caused so many
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: dissolutions of particulars, otherwise named deaths, as they did; for I
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: have destroyed but some few men in a little Boat, which dyed through the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: extremity of cold, and that by the hand of Justice, which was
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: necessitated to punish their crime of stealing away a young and
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: beauteous Lady. And in the formation of those Worlds, I take more
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: delight and glory, then ever Alexander or Cesar did in conquering this
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: terrestrial world; and though I have made my Blazing-World a Peaceable
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: World, allowing it but one Religion, one Language, and one Government;
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: yet could I make another World, as full of Factions, Divisions and
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Warrs, as this is of Peace and Tranquility; and the Rational figures of
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: my Mind might express as much courage to fight, as Hector and Achilles
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: had; and be as wise as Nestor, as; Eloquent as Ulysses, and be as
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: beautiful as Hellen. But I esteeming Peace before Warr, Wit before
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Policy, Honesty before Beauty; instead of the figures of Alexander,
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: Cesar, Hector, Achilles, Nestor, Ulysses, Hellen, &c. chose rather the
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: figure of Honest Margaret Newcastle, which now I would not change for
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: all this Terrestrial World; and if any should like the World I have
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: made, and be willing to be my Subjects, they may imagine themselves
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: but if they cannot endure to be Subjects, they may create Worlds of
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

text: their own, and Govern themselves as they please. But yet let them have a
title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

title: Cavendish, Margaret
author: The Description of a New World, Called The Blazing-World

title: Cavendish, Margaret
